page.title: 03Planning.
page.content: There is a marked contrast in house types found within the area.The newer areas have detached and semi-detached houses in comparison tothe traditional areas which tend to be terraced.This was usually governed by historical features such as coal mining and the provision of cheap houses for worker accomodation.In comparison to the more recent houses built some of the traditional houses have only recently acquired bathrooms and indoor toilets. The modern houses have smaller rooms and smaller gardens in comparison with the old traditional houses.It would appear that with high land prices, house developers are cramming new housing into very small areas with both 1 and 2 bedroomed houses being prevalent.Considerable emphasis is given to landscaping and integration with existing housing.
